HipsLVBentOverHipExtension.name: Lever Bent-over Hip Extension
HipsLVBentOverHipExtension.preparation: Step up onto platform. Position belly on wide pad, forearms on padded arm rest, and grip handles. Position bottom of foot on foot lever with lower leg under pad.
HipsLVBentOverHipExtension.execution: Push foot lever back by extending hip. Return leg to original position. Repeat. Reposition and continue with opposite leg.
HipsLVBentOverHipExtension.comments: Despite apparatus similarity to rear kick exercise, it is actually hip extension exercise due to the isolated hip movement which is apparent with lack of knee articulation.

HipsLVKneelingHipExtensionRoller.name: Lever Kneeling Hip Extension
HipsLVKneelingHipExtensionRoller.preparation: Kneel on lowest (shin) pad with roller pad behind lower thighs. Position midsection on middle pad. Place forearms on padded arm rest and grip handles.
HipsLVKneelingHipExtensionRoller.execution: Keeping one leg on shin pad, extend hip of other leg and push roller pad back. Raise roller pad up until hip is completely extended. Return leg to original position and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
HipsLVKneelingHipExtensionRoller.comments: Exercise can be performed alternating between sides.

HipsLVAlternatingKneelingHipExtRoll.name: Lever Alternating Kneeling Hip Extension
HipsLVAlternatingKneelingHipExtRoll.preparation: Kneel on lowest (shin) pad with roller pad behind lower thighs. Position midsection on middle pad. Place forearms on padded arm rest and grip handles.
HipsLVAlternatingKneelingHipExtRoll.execution: Keeping one leg on shin pad, extending hip of other leg and push roller pad back. Raise roller pad up until hip is completely extended. Return leg to original position. Repeat with opposite leg. Continue alternating between each side.
HipsLVAlternatingKneelingHipExtRoll.comments: Exercise can be performed with one leg, then other leg. See Lever Kneeling Hip Extension (roller pad).

HipsLVLyingHipExtension.name: Lever Lying Hip Extension
HipsLVLyingHipExtension.preparation: With leg lever positioned in the lower position, lie supine on machine with legs over padded bar. Align hip joints with lever fulcrum. Strap hips down with belt if available. Release leg lever and adjust until leg lever is in upper position. Grasp handles to sides of head.
HipsLVLyingHipExtension.execution: Push padded leg bar down until hips are extended. Return and repeat.
HipsLVLyingHipExtension.comments: Also Lever Lying Hip Extension on plate loaded machine and Lever Alternating Lying Hip Extension on another selectorized machine.

HipsLVAlternatingLyingHipExtension.name: Lever Alternating Lying Hip Extension
HipsLVAlternatingLyingHipExtension.preparation: Lie on bench with knees legs over pads. Align hip joints with lever fulcrum. Strap hips down with belt. Extend both hips with feet toward floor.
HipsLVAlternatingLyingHipExtension.execution: Raise one knee by flexing hip. Return to original position by extending hip. Repeat with opposite leg, alternating between sides.
HipsLVAlternatingLyingHipExtension.comments: Hamstring remains in active insufficiency through movement since knee is significantly flexed and hip does not flex beyond 90 degrees. Also see Lever Lying Hip Extension on plate loaded machine.

HipsLVStandingHipExtension.name: Lever Standing Hip Extension
HipsLVStandingHipExtension.preparation: Stand on platform facing to one side and grasp bar for support. Place leg nearest machine on padded roller while standing on other leg.
HipsLVStandingHipExtension.execution: Lower lever by extending hip. Return until knee is higher than hip. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

HipsLVStandingHipExtensionTech.name: Lever Standing Hip Extension (with abdominal pad)
HipsLVStandingHipExtensionTech.preparation: Stand on platform so front of hips are against edge of abdominal pad. Position flexed leg over padded roller while standing on other leg. Grasp handles with both hands.
HipsLVStandingHipExtensionTech.execution: Extend lever back by extending hip and straightening leg. Return by flexing hip and knee. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
HipsLVStandingHipExtensionTech.comments: Shorter individuals should stand on higher platform and may be bent over more.

HipsLVAlternatingLyingLegPress.name: Lever Alternating Seated Leg Press
HipsLVAlternatingLyingLegPress.preparation: Lie on machine with shoulder under pads. Place feet slightly high on individual lever platforms. Grasp handles to sides. Push both lever platforms away by extending knees and hips so knees are straight.
HipsLVAlternatingLyingLegPress.execution: Lower one lever platform toward body by bending knee and hip until weight taps or nearly taps unused portion of weight stack. Push lever platform away by extending knee and hip. Repeat with opposite leg. Continue by alternating between sides.
HipsLVAlternatingLyingLegPress.comments: Adjust bench to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. This exercise may be performed by alternating (as described), simultaneous, or in simultaneousalternating fashion.

HipsLVSeatedLegPress.name: Lever Seated Leg Press
HipsLVSeatedLegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place feet slightly high on platform. Grasp handles to sides.
HipsLVSeatedLegPress.execution: Extend knees and hips until knees are fully extended. Return until hips are completely flexed. Repeat.
HipsLVSeatedLegPress.comments: Adjust seat and back support to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasize Quadriceps.

HipsLVSingleLegLegPress.name: Lever Single Leg Seated Leg Press
HipsLVSingleLegLegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place one foot slightly high on platform and other foot on floor below platform.
HipsLVSingleLegLegPress.execution: Push platform away by extending hip and knee. Return by bending leg until knee or hip is just short of complete flexion. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
HipsLVSingleLegLegPress.comments: Adjust back support back to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing pelvis to bend at waist. Keep knee pointed same direction as foot. Do not allow heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot.

HipsLVBentOverRearKick.name: Lever Bent-over Glute Kickback
HipsLVBentOverRearKick.preparation: Lean over padded surface and grasp handles. Bend knee and position foot against lever platform or pedal.
HipsLVBentOverRearKick.execution: Push platform or pedal back by extending leg. Return leg to original position. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

HipsLVKneelingHipExtension.name: Lever Kneeling Glute Kickback
HipsLVKneelingHipExtension.preparation: Kneel on machine by placing one knee on lower pad. Rest torso on middle pad, place forearms on padded arm rest, and grip handles. Position other foot of other leg up to lever platform.
HipsLVKneelingHipExtension.execution: Push platform back by extending leg back. Return leg to original position and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

HipsLVSingleLegStandingLegPress.name: Lever Standing Glute Kickback
HipsLVSingleLegStandingLegPress.preparation: Step on left platform with left foot. Grasp handle bars to each side. Place right foot on highest lever platform.
HipsLVSingleLegStandingLegPress.execution: Push platform down by extending leg until straight. Return leg to original position. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg positions.
HipsLVSingleLegStandingLegPress.comments: With greater resistances, more effort is required to pull on handle bars to keep body from rising upward.

HipsLVSquat.name: Lever Squat
HipsLVSquat.preparation: Squat down to place shoulders under padded lever. Place feet shoulder width apart slightly in front of shoulders.
HipsLVSquat.execution: Raise lever up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Return and repeat.
HipsLVSquat.comments: Lever height should be adjusted to accommodate full range, allowing hips to descend same height or slightly lower than knees. Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See Squat Analysis.

HipsLVVSquat.name: Lever V-Squat
HipsLVVSquat.preparation: Position shoulders under shoulder pads with back against back pad. Place feet on platform, shoulder or hip width apart. Squeeze hand lever. Keeping hand lever squeezed, squat down by bending hips and knees until knees or hips are just short of complete flexion. Release hand lever and raise up on sled just slightly until weight stack is engaged (click is heard).
HipsLVVSquat.execution: Raise lever by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Squat down with knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until knees or hips are near complete flexion. Repeat.
HipsLVVSquat.comments: Squeeze hand lever at bottom of movement to disengage weight stack. Keep hand lever squeezed until sled is raised and legs are straight. If insufficient hip flexibility forces pelvis to pull away from back pad at lower portions of movement, only lower sled just short of spinal articulation. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly forward on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly back on platform emphasize Quadriceps.

HipsLVSingleLegVSquat.name: Lever Split V-Squat
HipsLVSingleLegVSquat.preparation: Position shoulders under shoulder pads with back against back pad. Place feet on platform, shoulder or hip width apart, slightly forward. Squeeze hand lever. Keeping hand lever squeezed, squat down by bending hips and knees until knees or hips are just short of complete flexion. Release hand lever and raise up on sled just slightly until weight stack is engaged (click is heard). Raise sled by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Place one leg back behind platform with toes pointed downward over floor.
HipsLVSingleLegVSquat.execution: Squat down with knee pointed same direction as foot. Allow leg to bend behind with forefoot on floor. Descend until forward hip is near complete flexion. Raise sled by extending knee and hip until leg is straight. Repeat. Continue with other leg.
HipsLVSingleLegVSquat.comments: Squeeze hand lever at bottom of movement to disengage weight stack. Keep hand lever squeezed until sled is raised and leg is straight. If insufficient hip flexibility forces pelvis to pull away from back pad at lower portions of movement, only lower sled just short of spinal articulation. Keep knee pointed same directions as foot. Do not allow heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly forward on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly back on platform emphasize Quadriceps. See manufacturers suggested foot placement for Lever Split VSquat.

HipsLVSingleLegSplitVSquat.name: Lever Single Leg Split V-Squat
HipsLVSingleLegSplitVSquat.preparation: Position shoulders under shoulder pads with back against back pad. Place one foot forward on platform. Place other foot against rear vertical platform. Squeeze hand lever. Keeping hand lever squeezed, squat down by bending hips and knees until hip or knee is short of complete flexion. Release hand lever and raise up on sled just slightly until weight stack is engaged (click is heard).
HipsLVSingleLegSplitVSquat.execution: Raise lever by extending knees and hips. Lower lever by flexing hips and knees until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg positions.
HipsLVSingleLegSplitVSquat.comments: Squeeze hand lever at bottom of movement to disengage weight stack. Keep hand lever squeezed until sled is raised and legs are straight. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow forward heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot.

HipsLVAlternatingSingleLegSplitVSquat.name: Lever Alternating Single Leg Split V-Squat
HipsLVAlternatingSingleLegSplitVSquat.preparation: Position shoulders under shoulder pads with back against back pad. Place feet slightly forward on platform. Squeeze hand lever. Keeping hand lever squeezed, squat down by bending hips and knees until hip or knee is short of complete flexion. Release hand lever and raise up on sled just slightly until weight stack is engaged (click is heard). Raise lever by extending knees and hips.
HipsLVAlternatingSingleLegSplitVSquat.execution: Transfer right foot back to inside of rear vertical platform. Lower lever by flexing hips and knees until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Raise lever by extending knees and hips until knee is straight. Return right foot to original position by other foot. Repeat with opposite leg movement and continue alternating between sides.
HipsLVAlternatingSingleLegSplitVSquat.comments: When finished, keep both feet forward and descend lever downward. Squeeze hand lever at bottom of movement to disengage weight stack. Keep hand lever squeezed until sled is raised and legs are straight. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Push with both heel and forefoot. Do not allow forward heel to raise off of platform.
